intro: Sorbus sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globular rowan, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its spherical, red berries that are clustered in dense, spherical formations, giving it its common name. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces yellowish flowers in spring. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. The berries are edible but contain seeds that are dispersed by birds and other animals.
